result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/ PAC (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Spencer Thomas Bourdon was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Good time and huber allowed - eligible for community service under 973.03(3).
On driver's license and all vehicles titled in his name commencing upon issuance of valid DL.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Spencer Thomas Bourdon
Current: 5263 Youngs Lane, PO Box 465, Crandon, WI 54520   (Effective: 07-01-2015)
Prior: 5263 Youngs Lane, Crandon, WI 54520
Called 3:24 PM. FTR recorded. No appearance by defendant. Request from defendant suggests $200 weekly. Court orders $500/month, commencing 11/2/15.

Defendant Spencer Thomas Bourdon in court with attorney Henry Reid Schultz.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:52 AM. Also called 15CM03. State - resolved - Amended Complaint filed on 15CM03 modifying count #1 from a 2nd offense to a 3rd offense and amending count #2 from a second offense to a 3rd offense. Schultz agrees. State - resolved - complied with victim notification requirements with no response, 15CM90 - amend count #3 to county  ordinance of BJ with forfeiture of $500.00 plus costs and dismiss remaining counts; 15CM03 - plead to count #1 as amended and alleged and acknowledge 2 prior convictions for OWI - joint recommendation for 45 days in jail - credit for 20 days, $1694.00 fine inclusive of costs, 24 month DL suspension. Schultz agrees. Court - 15CM90 - amend #3 to county ordinance of BJ, pleads G, finds G, forfeiture of $500.00 plus costs totalling $834.50 - payable at $500.00/month commencing 8/1/15/CO. Court dismisses counts #1, #2 and #4. 15CM03 - defendant pleads G to count #1 as amended. State moves to dismiss counts #2 and #3. Court dismisses counts #2 and #3. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State - follow joint recommendation. Schultz - follow joint recommendation. Bourdon makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 15CM03 - count #1 - 45 days in FC jail - huber, good and eligible for community service - 20 days credit - report today; AODA, 24 month DL revocation, IID on DL and all vehicles titled in his name for 24 months commencing upon issuance of valid DL, fine of $1694.00 - inclusive of costs - paid at same rate as other fine on 15CM90 ($500.00/month commencing 8/1/15), right to appeal, adjourned.

ADDRESS INFO for Spencer Thomas Bourdon
Current: 5263 Youngs Lane, Crandon, WI 54520   (Effective: 07-01-2015)
Prior: PO Box 465, 5263 Youngs Lane, Crandon, WI 54520

Defendant Spencer Thomas Bourdon in court with attorney Henry Reid Schultz.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Also called 15CM90. Called 3:30 pm. Here for FPT on 03 - matter resolved. State - plead to count 1 as alleged and remainder dismissed - 10 days jail (time served) - fine of $1028 - 12 mo dl revocation - AODA - IID 12 mo - defense withdraws his motion. All parties agree. Court dismisses counts 2 & 3  Defendant pleads NC to count 1 as alleged. Court goes thru plea questionnaire and finds that defendant is entering his plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently by entering his plea and waiving his right to JT, factual basis, accepts plea and adjudges G of count 1 as alleged. State/Schultz final statement. 3:39 pm short break to talk to attorney. 3:40 pm back on the record same appearances. Schultz makes statement and believes that this is a 3rd offense (due to Dodge Co case) 30 days jail mandatory with 20 days credit on jail term. State off record 3:41 pm.  Back on the reord 3:43 pm. State responds thankful that Schultz brought this to courts attention wants to continue with 2nd offense. Schultz responds to continuing with 2nd offense for stated reasons. Court has to have reason for not following the law. Schultz responds to courts comments. Court would want formal amendment to complaint. State asks for 1 week adjournment. Also asking for 15CM90 to be adjourned to next week. Schultz agrees. Schultz asks for signature bond on 15CM90. State responds no objection to signature bond.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 8, 2015 at 10:45 am.
brief in support  of motions to suppress
Exhibit #2 - CD from officer's stop - in exhibit box in vault

ADDRESS INFO for Spencer Thomas Bourdon
Current: PO Box 465, 5263 Youngs Lane, Crandon, WI 54520   (Effective: 01-07-2015)
Prior: 5263 Youngs Lane, Crandon, WI 54520

Defendant Spencer Thomas Bourdon in court with attorney Henry Reid Schultz.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 3:51 p.m. Schultz has filed motion to suppress for illegal arrest and statements to be suppressed. State calls Mark Raddatz (3:56 p.m.) Schultz asks for serquesration of all other witnesses. Schultz stipulates to identification & credentials for witness. State directs. Exhibit #1 marked (officer's report). Cross-examine by Schultz (4:14 p.m.) Schultz offers exhibit #2 (CD). Plays portions of video. Court receives exhibit #2. State - objection (4:35) - over ruled - state withdraws objection. Witness excused (4:36 p.m.) Deputy Don Belland sworn in (4:37 p.m.) State and Schultz stipulate to identification and credentials for witness. State directs. Cross-examine by Schultz (4:46 p.m.) Re-direct by State (4:48 p.m.) Schultz objection - sustained (4:48 p.m.) Witness excused from witness stand (4:49 p.m.) Court - accepts officers testimony and that officer was continuing investigation until Miranda rights were given. Schultz makes argument regarding arrest. State objections to argument. Court - instructs parties to brief - to be filed within 30 days (simultaneous briefs). State withdraws exhibit #1.  Motion hearing scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
and motion to suppress illegal arrest

Defendant Spencer Thomas Bourdon in court with attorney Henry Reid Schultz.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:17 AM. Schultz has complaint, waives reading, enters NG pleas. Court accepts pleas, continues bond, sets for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 09:15 am.

Defendant Spencer Thomas Bourdon not court nor does any attorney on his behalf.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State - has information from P&P that the defendant is in treatment until 2/19/15 and requests AIA. Court continues bond, set for another AIA.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 25, 2015 at 09:15 am.
No consumption of alcohol. No entery into any tavern or bar.
